newsitem.title: UK: HSBC to buy Argentina's Roberts.
newsitem.headline: HSBC to buy Argentina's Roberts.

text.p: HSBC Holdings Plc said on Friday it would buy all of the issued shares in Argentina's Roberts Group, a private financial services holding company including Banco Roberts, for between $600 and $688 million.
HSBC said in a statement the deal was subject to regulatory approvals and due diligence and completion was due to take place in July.

Roberts has interests ranging from corporate, retail and investment banking to insurance, pensions and healthcare. It owns 70.1 percent of Banco Roberts, with the remaining 29.9 percent already held by HSBC.

"HSBC through Midland is already an investor in Argentina, and this further investment represents a significant commitment to the country. The Roberts Group will complement Banco HSBC Bamerindus in Brazil and be a valuable addition to our other investments in Latin America," John Bond, HSBC chief executive, said.

Enrique Ruete, who will continue as chief executive of the Roberts Group said HSBC would bring a new international dimension to the group and give it advantages not available to other banks in Argentina.
Banking giant HSBC has 5,000 offices in 78 countries and assets totalling 237 billion pounds ($388.1 billion) at the end of last year.
